title: cannot connect to my msn.com e-mail in Thunderbird; been doing it for years but now password is not recognized.
content: my personal e-mail is @msn.com; been using it with Thunderbird for years, but lately it asks continually for my password and tells me login (imap/outlook) has failed. It's been getting more frequent and today after multiple attempts, and restarting my computer it still didn't work. I am able to use my password to sign into my msn.com account and see the e-mails using the mozilla browser (or chrome) but can't sign on at Thunderbird. I have another e-mail address in Thunderbird (at my own domain) and there have been no issues with that address. However, if I am looking at my personal/msn e-mails, then go to the other inbox and return to the msn inbox I am usually asked (repeatedly) for the msn password and login fails. The problem started a couple of weeks ago and has grown progressively worse/more frequent. Any ideas on what happened/changed and what I can do?
creator: ROXTRUAX

title: Email "move" between folders in latest Thunderbird (128) is unreliable, either failing or deleting messages
content:
Hi

I hope someone can provide me with some advice.

I have used Thunderbird since its birth and have always found it reliable. However the latest release seems to be having problems with moving emails.

Example 1 - I moved an email from my Inbox to a special folder. The email was present in full before the move. Only the header appeared to be copied. I could not undo this and attempting repair on both inbox and other folder failed, as did exit and re-start. The result is that this email is lost.

Example 2 - I went to do a bulk move from the search window (something I have done hundreds of times before without incident). As usual CTRL A, Move to <new folder>, emails greyed out but nothing happens. Exit, return, repeat - same result.

At other times, both these type of operations work fine. But it is unpredictable.

Relatedly, I observe that on start-up the Inbox initially shows as <no messages> and takes several seconds to populate. Also, my auto-filing Rules are also working inconsistently.

These two points, and the two examples, are new issues for me since 128 release. I am using Windows 10 Pro on an HP Envy 17" laptop.

Any suggestions welcome as I am now concerned about losing emails!

Best wishes Roland
creator: jollygreengiant

title: New Thunderbird User - Constant Hanging in Tasks module

title: Non riesco a scaricare la posta certificata di poste italiane Poste (@pcert.postecert.it)
content:
Mail arrivara da: avvisi_pec@postecert.it

Gentile cliente, 

a partire dal giorno 10/06/2024 verranno dismessi meccanismi di autenticazione, utilizzati dai client desktop (a titolo esemplificativo non esaustivo: Outlook, thunderbird o altro strumento usato per accedere alla posta elettronica) CRAM-MD5, APOP, Digest-MD5  fortemente sconsigliati perchÃ© obsoleti, al fine di innalzare il livello di sicurezza adeguandolo agli standard correnti. Per continuare a fruire del servizio tramite client desktop, si raccomanda di procedere allâ€™aggiornamento del proprio client di posta elettronica e alla verifica della congruitÃ  della configurazione utilizzata, di seguito riportata:  Server posta in arrivo: mail.postecert.it - protocollo pop3: il server richiede una connessione crittografata (ssl) porta 995 - protocollo imap: il server richiede una connessione crittografata (ssl) porta 993  Server posta in uscita: mail.postecert.it - protocollo smtp: il server richiede una connessione crittografata (ssl) porta 465 - Attivare la funzione: "Server della posta in uscita - Autenticazione del server necessaria"  In caso di bisogno, puoi contattare lâ€™Assistenza, usando i riferimenti presenti sul sito https://www.poste.it.  Poste Italiane

Ora, tutte le impostazioni sono corrette, ho effettuato tutti gli aggiornamenti previsti da Thunderbird ma ancora non riesco ad avere gli accessi per scaricare la posta e devo entrare ogni volta direttamente nel portale della posta certificata di Poste Italiane per verificare l'arrivo nuove comunicazioni.

Cosa mi consigliate di fare? Un caro saluto, Nadir Marchiori
creator: nadir.marchiori

alvast bedankt voor jouw antwoord en moeite!

hartelijke groet, astrid buijs

title: Mail from Kivra does not arrive
content:
Mail from Kivra does not arrive and when I contact email provider Ownit, they first say that there is something wrong with Kivra. Contacted Kivra and they say they are blocked by the email provider. I contact Ownit my e-mail provider again and they say that there must be an error in my mail client Thunderbird. Below is some information I received from both Ownit and Kivra. If anyone can help me figure out the error, I would appreciate it.

Mail from Kivra and Ownit:

Hello Martin,

Thank you for your message!

At the moment, I still don't see any strangeness from the delivery to you from us.

We have no blocks or anything like that regarding your email.

Assuming you have further questions, you should contact our customer service on 08 - 525 07 300.

With kind regards/Kind Regards, Joseph C. First Line Support

There is something in you that is blocking these emails.    I am Godman and trustee and receive mail from many authorities without problems. 
   But from Kivra it has suddenly stopped working. 
   If you as two suppliers could talk to each other and try to find what the error could be, it would make it extremely easy.    I have Thunderbird as a client and have also contacted them and there are no blocks from Kivra! 
   Sincerely    Martin Larsson 


   Hello Martin, 
   Apologies for the delayed response. 
   We have taken this matter further for deeper troubleshooting. Do you have the opportunity to check if Kivra has received an error message when they tried to email you, we would need to take a look at that error message then if you could send it in reverse mail.

Thank you for your message!

As my colleague had previously pointed out, the Mail client does not belong to us who block,

you probably use an external client such as outlook or microsoft mail to log in.

â€‹Unfortunately, we cannot do anything about these problems as they do not come from us.

Get in touch if you have any further questions.

With kind regards/Kind Regards, Joseph C. First Line Support

title: Server login/authentication error sending Hotmail from Thunderbird
content:
Hello, I have two Hotmail accounts on Thunderbird, one @hotmail.com and one @hotmail.es (if that makes any difference). Both working fine since switching from Windows to Linux a week ago. As of this morning, the hotmail.com address can't send emails (it can receive them no problem). The hotmail.es email can send and receive no problem, although it has the same settings.

When I try to send an email I get the error: "login to server smtp-mail.outlook.com with username ...,@hotmail.com failed. " If I click on 'enter new password', it just tries to send the email again without asking for a password, although I don't think that's the issue because I can login via the outlook.com website using that same password.

When I click cancel, I get the error: "Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to outgoing server (SMTP). Please check the password and verify the authentication method in account settings/outgoing server/(SMTP)".

I've checked both POP settings and outgoing server settings and they are the same for both accounts, apart from the email address obviously (pic below). I got these settings from the Microsoft page: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040

Microsoft support said it's a Thunderbird problem. I've tried disabling my firewall and VPN. Would appreciate any other ideas (in absolute beginner terms if possible). Many thanks for reading.

Thunderbird 128.0.1esr (64-bit), Linux Mint 22 Cinnamon 64-bit, Gufw Firewall 24.04.0, VPN Surfshark 3.0.3, Hotmail.com, ISP = Three 5G
creator: NoprobLlama

title: Thunderbird problems
content:
Iâ€™m hoping that there is someone out there that could help me with my e-mail problems.

I have been a Thunderbird user for what seems like 30 years or more, but certainly it is a long time. For the best part of this time, so at least for over 15 years, I have been having problems that no one has been able to help me with. But, I just love how Thunderbird is laid out, and honestly, I am a creature of habit! Many friends have advised I move somewhere else, but have refrained to do so.

Where to start! My initial provider was madasafish, and later ported over to Thunderbird. After a few years, a female techie. friend set up my mails to use on PlusNet, so I could receive and send on my mobile too.

This went fairly well for a while, until PlusNet were not providing a very good service for e-mails, so now it is nearly impossible to use PlusNet, as after each action such as transferring an e-mail to a folder, it goes into refresh mode, and can sit there for minutes or hours! Is it possible to sync. my e-mails with a better provider other than PlusNet, and if so, could you please help me out with this?

However, a problem that Iâ€™ve had for some time now is not only have I lost a lot of e-mails from Thunderbird (and no one has been able to help me to recover them), but I am having difficulty sending e-mail from Thunderbird. The limitation of data now allowed on Thunderbird is very limiting, so I have had to learn from my son how to save my e-mails in a separate folder on my pc at a too regular basis.

What has motivated me to write again after so many years, is that it appears that there are changes coming about by Thunderbird that have been recently advertised, and I was rather hoping that there would be some developments that could make my life easier after such a long time.

You donâ€™t have to be a techie. to recognise that I am not, so if anyone has the knowledge and patience to help me out, I would be very grateful.
creator: stixman

title: TB Stopped updating news feeds - 129.0b6 (64-bit)
content:
Well, some of them, like my 711 YouTube subscriptions. This started three or four days ago when I noticed nothing new in the feeds folders.

I've not disabled the feeds and all looks well in the settings. I have restarted TB, checked to make sure get new messages was active, tried this in Safe Mode and nothing has made a difference.

I created a new feed, uploaded the OPML file to it and it grabbed 10,000+ ancient files and it updates when it's supposed to. But the old setup, with filters and folders, still does not work.

I found the new folder and the old one and copied the files from there to the old directory and.... nothing.

What might have happened?

It's as if the account simply no longer exists when I click FILE/GET NEW MESSAGES FOR/ and then select the account... nothing. Nothing shows up in the error console and I don't know where else to look. But I'd really prefer not to have to rebuild this whole thing.
creator: jeffinputnam

title: Sending to one email address gets "mailbox is full" error. Sending to other email addresses still works.

title: inserting images
content:
I have been using Thunderbird as my email client for many years, now in a W11 64-bit environment. Whenever I click on "insert image" to put an image into the message the whole thing freezes and all I can do is to invoke the task manager to force the closure of the program.

I did not have this problem in December 2023, which is the last time I wanted to insert images into an email. I can still attach an image or images without a problem. Sometimes, but not always, this is a viable alternative.

Is this a known problem? Is there a fix (easy or otherwise)? Will this problem be resolved in the next update and if so is there a date for its release?

Adrian Grant

title: Thunderbird forcing updates despite disabling them
content:
I installed TB version 102 and do not wish to update. Per previous no-updating solutions I found, I have the "Check for updates, but let me choose whether to install them" option tagged, I renamed "updater.exe" to "no-updater.exe," and have the following JSON in my distributions folder:

{ 

"policies": {   "DisableAppUpdate": true }

}

Yet, today, it still automatically updated to version 128. Why?
creator: spg2500

title: Change layout of message display thunderbird 128
content: Yesterday I upgraded to thunderbird 128. I have messages displayed in horizontal layout. Previously each message in the top pane used only one line, and there was minimal space between messages. Now each message requires two lines, with a large gap between messages. This means that I can see fewer than half as many messages at one time as before. How can I change the layout so each message takes up less space in the top pane?

title: Email Inbox Questions
content:
Questions re Email Inbox and Reply window:

1) I can't find a list here showing the Inbox icons and what they mean, specifically this one. I can't delete it, nor do I see anything in the inbox list of column indicators that it might be. I'd like to know what it's for and if/how it can be removed.

2) I want to have more space for the message pane; the only way to do this is to have a smaller font size for the email List pane. I don't see where I can change this. Is it possible to decrease this font size? I've tried but haven't t been able to locate info on this website.)

3) Reply font: I keep changing it to my Preference, but it keeps going back to a default.

Also, find it annoying that I can't select a specific font SIZE. I've never seen a Windows desktop software of ANY kind, not just email, which doesn't give have choice of font size as well as the font itself. Is there a suggestion area on this website?

Thanks.

title: The current operation on 'Kailah' did not succeed. The mail server for account xxx@gmail.com responded: [NONEXISTENT] Invalid folder: Financial/Venmo/Kailah (Failure).
content: Hi. When I view the Activity Manager, I see many log entries similar to the following except with different folders: "The current operation on 'Kailah' did not succeed. The mail server for account xxx@gmail.com responded: [NONEXISTENT] Invalid folder: Financial/Venmo/Kailah (Failure)." The folder in question existed a long time ago and has since been deleted. Same for all the other similar messages. The folder(s) was / were originally created in Thunderbird and then deleted after many months. If I create the invalid folder in Gmail, the message no longer logged. I reboot the computer daily and every day these messages appear. I am assuming something is out of sync and Thunderbird believes these folders exist. What can I do to remove these issues. Server type is IMAP Mail Server. Using Thunderbird 115.14.0 (64-bit)

title: Thunderbird 128 high CPU when idle for several minutes. 115 not affected. (has performance profile)
content:
Hello! I recently got the update to Thunderbird 128 on my PopOS laptop via sudo apt update/upgrade. I don't know what the previous version was. Since the update, Thunderbird will spike my CPU to 120 - 140% (per command-line "top") if I have an interaction with it (e.g. reading and then deleting an email that was received) after the program has been sitting idle for several minutes. After a few minutes of loud fans, things calm down again so I presume Thunderbird is doing some sort of maintenance routine that completes successfully.

I do not have the global search index thing turned on. I did not change the default mailbox db idle time. I do have rather large mailboxes that are synced via SMTP, from three different providers. There are dozens of folders (not hundreds) containing thousands if messages (but not tens of thousands). Hopefully that gives an idea of scale .. I don't have a massive overload of untended email history but I do have a quantity of historical emails that the system has to deal with.

I followed the excellent directions online to obtain a profile during one of these high-cpu sessions. It is available at https://share.firefox.dev/4dAmyAz

Please let me know if there is anything further I can do to help diagnose this issue, such as generating more specific profiles. The high-cpu state is a pretty common occurrance now.
creator: daves0

title: Constant Freezing of Emails
content: Over the past few weeks my emails are constantly freezing up when I open Thunderbird. It hangs up and I have to close the program and then restart, sometimes having to do this several times. It will then be normal for a short while, and start doing it again. I am running Windows 7 on my PC, I have the latest Thunderbird downloaded up until two weeks ago I never had this issue. I have not installed any new software either. I did think maybe it was CCleaner or Advanced Systemcare so I uninstalled those two programs yet the problem is still ongoing. Its quite frustrating and I can't figure out why its happening or what a potential fix for it. Thank you to those who respond.
creator: kinsella5jon
